response:
reasoning='We need to produce a Spectre netlist for a folded-cascode OTA called fc_ota that exactly matches the user’s template. That means:
1. Keep the header comments verbatim.
2. Use “subckt fc_ota VDD VSS ibn10u vin vip vout” with no leading dot.
3. Include a folded-cascode topology sized for ~10 µA bias using only tsmc18dN/P models. We chose a simple bias mirror off the single bias port (ibn10u) to generate both the NMOS tail current mirror and the PMOS mirror for cascodes and load. Input devices are 20 µm/0.18 µm, cascode PMOS 24 µm/0.18 µm, load PMOS 48 µm/0.18 µm, bias reference NMOS 2 µm/0.18 µm, tail NMOS 4 µm/0.18 µm, PMOS reference 12 µm/0.18 µm. Nodes netx and nety carry the two branches, netp is the PMOS gate bias, netTail is the input pair source, ibn10u is the bias input.  
4. Terminate with “ends fc_ota” (no leading dot).  
5. Append the footer comments and top-level instantiation “I1 (net1 net2 net5 net3 net4 net6) fc_ota” exactly.  
6. No extra text, no markdown, no code fences.
' config=ConfigFile(netlist='// Library name: MP4
// Cell name: fc_ota
// View name: schematic
subckt fc_ota VDD VSS ibn10u vin vip vout
MNref   (ibn10u ibn10u VSS VSS) tsmc18dN w=2u   l=0.18u
MNtail  (netTail ibn10u VSS VSS) tsmc18dN w=4u   l=0.18u
MPref   (netp netp     VDD VDD) tsmc18dP w=12u  l=0.18u
MPcas1  (netx netp     VDD VDD) tsmc18dP w=24u  l=0.18u
MPcas2  (nety netp     VDD VDD) tsmc18dP w=24u  l=0.18u
MN1     (netx vin      netTail VSS) tsmc18dN w=20u l=0.18u
MN2     (nety vip      netTail VSS) tsmc18dN w=20u l=0.18u
MPmir   (vout netp     VDD VDD) tsmc18dP w=48u  l=0.18u
ends fc_ota
// Top-level instantiation
// Library name: MP4
// Cell name: dut
// View name: schematic
I1 (net1 net2 net5 net3 net4 net6) fc_ota')
